instructions: Wash the rice and lentils thoroughly and soak them in water for about 30 minutes.
Heat ghee or oil in a pressure cooker or pot.
Add cumin seeds and asafoetida. Once the asafoetida puffs up, add whole red chilies and stir until they change color.
Add turmeric powder and chili powder. Stir well.
Add the soaked rice and lentils to the pot.
If using a pressure cooker, cook for 3-4 whistles. If using a pot, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the rice and lentils are cooked and mushy.
For the tempering (optional): Heat a little ghee in a separate pan. Add cumin seeds and whole red chilies. Once they splutter, pour this tempering over the khichdi.
cooking_tips: Adjust the water consistency depending on how thick or thin you want your khichdi.
You can add vegetables like carrots, peas, and potatoes to make it more nutritious.
Serve hot with a dollop of ghee or yogurt.
